so there's a couple of things that are going on with this so the security tag um Justin who is a member he's a
technical lead um we've gone through and re we've revamped how Security reviews are done
in the way that the structure is set up such that a self review by the project is usually ideal for sandbox
applications or really early incubating projects and it's a guiding point for
them to set up the security of their project from there between incubation and graduation The Joint review is
intended to be conducted the combination of the self review and the joint review are usually handed over for a security
audit for projects that really weren't that extra level of security attention we've found in the past that having both
the joint review and the self review as uh as precursors to the security audit
not necessarily a requirement but just having that extra documentation and research done makes the audits go a lot
smoother and those projects are generally set up for a much healthier audit experience and the Auditors
themselves find a lot of value you in that content given everything that I'm hearing currently about the initial and
